Perniciously Aneimic, hella anxious, depressed widow, biromantic demisexual . Slytherin. OTP: Narava/Corso, Alt OTP: Avarane/Corso, Completely different fandom otp: Perc'ahlia. Pens/Stanley Cup. She/her. Unless you’re Taliesin Jaffe, I’m not interested.

blog.name: night-filled-mountain
blog.description:
“Each atom of that stone, each mineral flake of that night-filled mountain, in itself forms a world. The struggle itself toward the heights is enough to fill a man's heart. One must imagine Sisyphus happy.”

-Albert Camus, “The Myth of Sisyphus”

tags: i feel like that one verse + the entirety of 'the river the woods' = pretty much all the themes i cherish in the m9's story
going home or finding/making a home for the first time
freedom from all bonds except the ones you choose
personal goals derailed by love and loyalty
hopeless people risking everything for that one elusive sliver of hope
summary: At some point, I’m going to write a whole post analyzing every single lyric of “The River, the Woods” by Astronautalis (from...
body:
At some point, I’m going to write a whole post analyzing every single lyric of “The River, the Woods” by Astronautalis (from Caleb’s playlist) as a song for the entire Mighty Nein.

But in the meantime, I’m going to keep listening to “Fire Under Water” from Yasha’s playlist and being shattered by the same verse every time.

“Every ship that I had captained
Had been lost to stormy weather
Until you came along, and I thought we
Just might get home together
I thought we might get home together…”

reblog.comment:

I thought we might get home together…”

But in the meantime, I’m going to keep listening to “Fire Under Water” from Yasha’s playlist and being shattered by the same verse every time.

“Every ship that I had captained

trail.content:
At some point, I’m going to write a whole post analyzing every single lyric of “The River, the Woods” by Astronautalis (from Caleb’s playlist) as a song for the entire Mighty Nein.

But in the meantime, I’m going to keep listening to “Fire Under Water” from Yasha’s playlist and being shattered by the same verse every time.

“Every ship that I had captained
Had been lost to stormy weather
Until you came along, and I thought we
Just might get home together
I thought we might get home together…”

blog.name: princessamericachavez
blog.title: Your Ticket to the Multiverse
blog.description: Mexican 24. Journalist, writer, geek. Currently majoring in creative writing. She/Her.

summary:
Okay but also the ghost jellyfish possessing the giant's corpse.
Think about the angst potential! 
Like if Fjord dies and Jester...
body:
Okay but also the ghost jellyfish possessing the giant’s corpse.

Think about the angst potential!

Like if Fjord dies and Jester is crying and fumbling to get her diamonds and suddenly through the tears she seesthis beautiful jellyfish, just like the ones they saw together and it goes into his chest and he wakes up but it isn’t fjord, he grabs her by the throat and tries to slice her with his sword

BECAUSE SOMETIMES THE THINGS THAT ARE THE MOST BEAUTIFUL ARE THE THINGS THAT CAN HURT YOU THE WORST
